Umineko Project (UP): "......I have received a red truth denying you from Lady {f:5:Bernkastel}. ......I am afraid that this will become your {f:5:grave}...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I have received a red truth denying you from Lady Bernkastel. ......I'm afraid that this will become your GRAVE...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……あなたを否定する赤き真実を、ベルンカステル卿より賜っていマス。……ここがあなたの墓場となり、残念デス…！」
Russian (RU): "......Я получила от леди {f:5:Бернкастель} отвергающую вас красную правду. ......Боюсь, это место станет вашей {f:5:могилой}!.."

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……貝倫卡斯泰露卿賜予我，將你否定的紅色真實。……此處將會成為你的墳墓，非常遺憾…！」

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Ho ricevuto la verità rossa che la nega da Lady Bernkastel. ... Temo che questa diventerà la sua TOMBA...!"

Steam (ST): I don't know what {f:5:Bernkastel} has allowed her to say. However, I don't need to sit around and let that longsword tell me.
Umineko Project (UP): I don't know what {f:5:Bernkastel} has allowed her to say.{n}However, I don't need to sit around and let that longsword tell me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I don't know what Bernkastel has allowed her to say. However, I don't need to sit around and let that longsword tell me.
PC Japanese (JP): ベルンカステルに何を許されたかはわからない。しかし、それを太刀で食らってまで確かめてやる義理はない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ベルンカステルに何を許されたかはわからない。{n}しかし、それを太刀で食らってまで確かめてやる義理はない。
Russian (RU): Не знаю, что там {f:5:Бернкастель} позволила ей сказать.{n}Но я не собираюсь стоять без дела и ждать, когда она скажет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não sei o que a {f:5:Bernkastel} a permitiu dizer.{n}Mas eu não tenho a obrigação de ficar esperando esse montante me dizer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不知道德拉諾爾從貝倫卡斯泰露那裡得到了什麼允許。{n}但是，沒理由不惜被戰刀砍到也要去搞清楚這事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不知道德拉诺尔从贝伦卡斯泰露那里得到了什么允许。{n}但是，没理由不惜被战刀砍到也要去搞清楚这事。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non so cosa Bernkastel le abbia permesso di dire. Tuttavia, non ho bisogno di rimanere seduta e lasciare che me lo dica quella spada.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "I'll play with you all you want later. But for now, back off!"
Umineko Project (UP): "I'll play with you all you want later. But for now, back off!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「待会儿妾身会陪汝好好玩玩的。但是现在汝快点闪开！」

Steam (ST): There's no time. The Chiesters have already finished reactivating. I'm only living on a bit of borrowed time.
Umineko Project (UP): There's no time. The Chiesters have already finished reactivating.{n}I'm only living on a bit of borrowed time.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 時間が無い。もうシエスタたちは再起動を終えている。{n}わずかのロスタイムで生かされてるに過ぎない。

Speaker: Dlanor

Russian (RU): "{f:5:Отступите} здесь только вы!.. Жалкая актриса, ступившая на {f:5:сцену} в неподходящее время!"

Umineko Project (UP): Dlanor's red longsword cut a large arc of absolute denial, ......which headed right for the crown of Beato's head.

Umineko Project (UP): Beato didn't let this good fortune go to waste.

PC Japanese (JP): 「今、あなたを助け出します。もうしばらくだけ、辛抱して下さい…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「今、あなたを助け出します。もうしばらくだけ、辛抱して下さい…」
Russian (RU): "Я сейчас спасу вас. Потерпите ещё немного..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu vou salvá‐lo agora. Por favor, aguente só mais um pouco..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「現在我就把你救出來。請再稍微忍耐一下…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「现在我就把你救出来。请再稍微忍耐一下…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sto venendo a salvarti ora. Per favore resisti un altro po'..."

Steam (ST): Beato's resolute expression returned, and she grinned boldly, looking down on Erika.
Umineko Project (UP): Beato's resolute expression returned, and she grinned boldly, looking down on Erika.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトは再び毅然とした表情に戻り、不敵に笑い、ヱリカを、見下す。
Russian (RU): Беато вернула решительное выражение и смело ухмыльнулась, свысока смотря на Эрику.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A expressão determinada retornou à face de Beato; ela sorriu com confiança, fazendo pouco caso de Erika.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝阿朵再次恢復毅然的表情，充滿信心地笑著，輕蔑地俯視繪梨花。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵再次恢复毅然的表情，充满信心地笑着，轻蔑地俯视绘梨花。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): L'espressione risoluta di Beato ritornò e sogghignò arditamente, guardando Erika.

Steam (ST): Ah, there can be no doubt... ...That's the expression worn only by the Golden Witch, ...the presence of the master of closed rooms.
Umineko Project (UP): Yes, there could be no doubt. ...This was the expression worn only by the Golden Witch, ......the majestic presence of the master of locked rooms.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ah, there can be no doubt... ...That's the expression worn only by the Golden Witch, ......the presence of the master of closed rooms.
PC Japanese (JP): あぁ、その表情こそ紛れもなく、……黄金の魔女だけが見せてくれた、……密室の王者の貫禄なのだ。
Russian (RU): А‐а, сомнений нет... Такое выражение могло быть только у Золотой ведьмы...... хозяйки закрытых комнат.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sim, não há dúvidas quanto a isso. ...Esta era a expressão que apenas a Bruxa Dourada poderia exibir, ......a majestosa presença da mestra dos quartos fechados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 啊啊，那表情中顯露出的，毫無疑問，……正是黃金的魔女方才具有的，……密室之王的威嚴。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 啊啊，那表情中显露出的，毫无疑问，……正是黄金的魔女方才具有的，……密室之王的威严。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ah, non ci poteva essere dubbio... quella era l'espressione usata solo dalla Strega Dorata... la presenza della padrona delle stanze chiuse.

Steam (ST): A shadow dashed through the stormy rose garden. It was incredibly light and swift.
Umineko Project (UP): A shadow dashed through the stormy rose garden.{n}It was incredibly light and swift.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A shadow dashed through the stormy rose garden. It was incredibly light and swift.
PC Japanese (JP): 嵐に荒れる薔薇庭園を、人影が疾駆する。その影は、あまりに軽やかで、そして素早い。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 嵐に荒れる薔薇庭園を、人影が疾駆する。{n}その影は、あまりに軽やかで、そして素早い。
Russian (RU): Тень неслась по бурному розарию.{n}Невероятно легко и быстро.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma sombra correu pelo tempestuoso jardim de rosas.{n}Era incrivelmente leve e rápida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 狂風大作的玫瑰庭園中，一個人影疾馳而過。{n}那個身影無比輕捷且迅速。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 狂风大作的玫瑰庭园中，一个人影疾驰而过。{n}那个身影无比轻捷且迅速。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Un'ombra corse attraverso il tempestoso roseto. Era incredibilmente leggera e agile.

Steam (ST): The raindrops never touched him, he made no splashes in the countless puddles, his feet left no tracks in the mud.
Umineko Project (UP): The raindrops never touched him, he made no splashes in the countless puddles, his feet left no tracks in the mud.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The raindrops never touched him, he made no splashes in the countless puddles, his feet left no tracks in the mud.
PC Japanese (JP): 雨粒さえ捕らえられず、無数の水溜りは散らすことも、泥濘は轍を作ることさえ許されない。
Russian (RU): Капли не касались его, от его шагов не плескались лужи и не оставалось следов в грязи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As gotas de chuva não a atingiam, sem saltar água das incontáveis poças que passava, seus pés não deixavam rastros de lama para trás.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從雨滴中穿過，踏過無數水窪也不會濺起水花，經過泥濘的土地也不會留下任何腳印。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从雨滴中穿过，踏过无数水洼也不会溅起水花，经过泥泞的土地也不会留下任何脚印。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Le gocce di pioggia non lo toccarono mai, non produsse alcuno schizzo nelle numerose pozzanghere, i suoi piedi non lasciarono traccia nel fango.

Steam (ST): That rushing figure...was Kanon...
Umineko Project (UP): That rushing figure.........was Kanon...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That rushing figure......was Kanon...
PC Japanese (JP): その疾駆する影は、………嘉音だった…。
Russian (RU): Этой несущейся фигурой...... был Канон...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A figura que corria apressada.........era Kanon...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那個疾馳的身影，………是嘉音…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那个疾驰的身影，………是嘉音…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quella figura che correva... era Kanon...

Steam (ST): Then, he ran up the stairs... to the entrance of the mansion.
Umineko Project (UP): Then, he ran up the stairs......to the entrance of the mansion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, he ran up the stairs, ......to the entrance of the mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): そして階段を駆け上り、……屋敷の玄関へ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そして階段を駆け上り、……屋敷の玄関へ。
Russian (RU): Он взбежал по лестнице......к входу в особняк.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ele correu escada à cima......em direção à entrada da mansão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後他跑上階梯，……來到大屋的門口。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后他跑上阶梯，……来到大屋的门口。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Poi, lui corse sulle scale... verso l'entrata della villa.

Steam (ST): He did not slow down in the slightest to open the door.
Umineko Project (UP): He did not slow down in the slightest to open the door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He did not slow down in the slightest to open the door.
PC Japanese (JP): 扉を開けるために立ち止まる様子は、一切ない。
Russian (RU): Даже ничуть не замедлился, чтобы открыть дверь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele não diminuiu em nada sua velocidade ao abrir a porta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 絲毫沒有因為要開門而放慢腳步的意思。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 丝毫没有因为要开门而放慢脚步的意思。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non rallentò minimamente per aprire la porta.

Steam (ST): ...He ran straight at it as though trying to break through, ...and leapt into it...!
Umineko Project (UP): ......He ran straight at it as though trying to break through......and leapt into it...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......He ran straight at it as though trying to break through, ......and leapt into it...!
PC Japanese (JP): ……そのまま、打ち破るかのようにますますに疾走し、……飛び込む…！
Russian (RU): ......Он побежал прямо на неё, будто приготовившись прорваться...... и прыгнул в неё!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ele correu reto por ela, como se fosse quebrá‐la para atravessar......e saltou em sua direção...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……就好像要把門撞破一樣，愈發加快速度急衝，……一頭撞進去…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……就好像要把门撞破一样，愈发加快速度急冲，……一头撞进去…！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Lui corse dritto verso di essa come per sfondarla... e balzò dentro...!

Steam (ST): Though the door was shut, even that couldn't stop Kanon.
Umineko Project (UP): Though the door was shut, even that couldn't stop Kanon.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 閉じたままのはずの扉さえも、嘉音を退けることは出来ない。
Russian (RU): Канона не могла остановить даже закрытая дверь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo a porta estando fechada, nem mesmo isso foi capaz de parar Kanon.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就連緊閉的門扉也不能阻擋嘉音的腳步。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就连紧闭的门扉也不能阻挡嘉音的脚步。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nonostante la porta fosse chiusa, nemmeno quello fermò Kanon.

Steam (ST): He slipped through the door, fell into the entranceway, and slowly stood up.
Umineko Project (UP): He slipped through the door, fell into the entranceway, and slowly stood up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He slipped through the door, fell into the entranceway, and slowly stood up.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼は扉をすり抜け、玄関の内側に転げ、ゆっくりと立ち上がる。
Russian (RU): Он проскочил через неё, упал при входе и медленно поднялся.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele passou através da porta, caiu no interior e lentamente se levantou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他穿過門，在大門內側打了個滾，緩緩站起身來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他穿过门，在大门内侧打了个滚，缓缓站起身来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Scivolò attraverso la porta, cadde nell'entrata e lentamente si alzò in piedi.

Steam (ST): His body wasn't even wet.
Umineko Project (UP): His body wasn't even wet.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): His body wasn't even wet.
PC Japanese (JP): その体は濡れてさえいなかった。
Russian (RU): Его тело даже не намокло.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seu corpo sequer estava molhado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他身上甚至一絲被打濕的痕跡都沒有。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他身上甚至一丝被打湿的痕迹都没有。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il suo corpo non era nemmeno bagnato.

Steam (ST): ...And, ...as he recalled those nostalgic days spent serving the Ushiromiya family, which would never come again, ...he ran once more.
Umineko Project (UP): ......And, ......as he recalled those nostalgic days spent serving the Ushiromiya family, which would never come again, ......he ran once more.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ………そして、……二度と訪れることのない、懐かしき右代宮家での日々を回想しながら、……再び走る。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E, ......enquanto relembrava os nostálgicos dias que passou servindo à família Ushiromiya, os quais nunca mais retornariam, ......ele continuou a correr.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ………然后，……回想着在右代宫家度过的，那些一去不回的、令人怀念的日子，……再次跑起来。

Umineko Project (UP): He was heading for Battler's guest room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He was heading for Battler's guest room.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele seguiu em direção ao quarto de hóspedes de Battler.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 向著戰人的客房，
Chinese Simplified (CN): 向着战人的客房，
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si stava dirigendo verso la stanza degli ospiti di Battler.

Steam (ST): He ran past the servant room, through the entrance hall, and past the door to the parlor.
Umineko Project (UP): He ran past the servant room, through the entrance hall, and past the door to the parlor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He ran past the servant room, through the entrance hall, and past the door to the parlor.
PC Japanese (JP): 使用人室の前を抜け、玄関ホールを抜け、客間の扉の前を駆け抜ける。
Russian (RU): Он пробежал мимо комнаты слуг, по залу и мимо двери в гостиную.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Correu passando pela sala dos serviçais, através do hall de entrada, e passou pela porta da sala de visitas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從傭人室前穿過，穿過大門門廳，從客廳的門前跑過。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从佣人室前穿过，穿过大门门厅，从客厅的门前跑过。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Corse passando la stanza dei domestici, attraverso l'atrio, e passò la porta del salotto.

Steam (ST): Then, the doors to the kitchen and the dining hall came into sight...
Umineko Project (UP): Then, the doors to the kitchen and the dining hall came into sight...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, the doors to the kitchen and the dining hall came into sight...
PC Japanese (JP): そして見えてくる厨房への扉や食堂の扉…。
Russian (RU): Затем в обзор вошли двери на кухню и в столовую...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, as portas da cozinha e da sala de jantar surgiram em sua visão...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後出現在眼前的廚房門和餐廳的門…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后出现在眼前的厨房门和餐厅的门…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Poi, le porte della cucina e della sala da pranzo furono in vista...

Steam (ST): All of it brings back fond memories.
Umineko Project (UP): All of it brings back fond memories.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): All of it brings back fond memories.
PC Japanese (JP): 全てが、全てが懐かしい。
Russian (RU): Всё это навевало приятные воспоминания.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Tudo isso trazia agradáveis recordações.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 全部，全部都那麼親切。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 全部，全部都那么亲切。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tutto ciò gli riportava alla mente teneri ricordi.

Steam (ST): ...There was the honor and rigidity of serving Kinzo directly.
Umineko Project (UP): ......There was the honor and discipline of serving Kinzo directly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......There was the honor and rigidity of serving Kinzo directly.
PC Japanese (JP): ……金蔵に直接仕えることを許された名誉と、厳しさ。
Russian (RU): ......Служить непосредственно Кинзо было и почётно, и тяжело.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Havia a honra e disciplina de servir Kinzo pessoalmente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……直接侍奉金藏，同時給嘉音帶來了榮譽和嚴苛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……直接侍奉金藏，同时给嘉音带来了荣誉和严苛。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... C'era l'onore e l'inflessibilità di servire direttamente Kinzo.

Steam (ST): However, that man wasn't rigid all the time.
Umineko Project (UP): However, that man wasn't strict all the time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, that man wasn't rigid all the time.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし彼は、その全ての時間が厳しかったわけではない。
Russian (RU): Но этот человек не всегда был суровым.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, aquele homem não era severo o tempo todo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，金藏並不是什麼時候都是那麼嚴苛的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，金藏并不是什么时候都是那么严苛的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, quell'uomo non era inflessibile tutto il tempo.

Steam (ST): ...When the family was out of sight and he didn't have to preserve that air of majesty, his face could turn unbelievably childish, and he would sometimes ask me to take part in strange pranks.
Umineko Project (UP): ......When the family was out of sight and he didn't have to preserve that air of majesty, his face could turn unbelievably childish, and he would sometimes ask me to take part in strange pranks.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……その威厳を保って見せねばならない家族の姿がない時、信じられないくらい子供っぽい顔を見せて、おかしな悪戯の片棒を頼んできたりするのだ。
Russian (RU): ......Когда рядом не было семьи и он не производил величественное впечатление, его лицо могло стать невероятно детским, а иногда он просил меня поучаствовать в странных шутках.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Quando a família não estava, e ele não precisava preservar seu ar de majestade, sua expressão tornava‐se inacreditavelmente infantil e, às vezes, ele me pedia para ajudar em alguma pegadinha estranha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……他必須在家人面前保持威嚴，而當家人不在跟前的時候，他會顯露出令人難以置信的孩子氣的一面，讓別人陪他玩一些奇奇怪怪的惡作劇。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……他必须在家人面前保持威严，而当家人不在跟前的时候，他会显露出令人难以置信的孩子气的一面，让别人陪他玩一些奇奇怪怪的恶作剧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Quando la famiglia non lo vedeva e non doveva preservare quell'aria di maestà, il suo volto poteva diventare incredibilmente infantile, e qualche volta mi chiedeva di prendere parte in strani scherzi.

Steam (ST): ......The Master let me shoot lots of guns, didn't he...
Umineko Project (UP): .........The Master let me shoot lots of guns, didn't he...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ………お館様に、銃を色々撃たせてもらったっけ。
Russian (RU): .........Господин дал мне выстрелить из многих ружей...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........O Mestre me deixava atirar com várias armas, não é...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………老爺，讓我玩過不少槍。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………老爷，让我玩过不少枪。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Il Padrone mi ha fatto sparare con molti fucili, già...

Steam (ST): ...That...was pretty fun.
Umineko Project (UP): ...That......was pretty fun.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …あれ、……結構、面白かったな。
Russian (RU): ...Было...... очень интересно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Aquilo......era muito divertido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …那個，……很有趣吶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …那个，……很有趣呐。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Fu... piuttosto divertente.

Steam (ST): Krauss-sama was actually surprisingly kind.
Umineko Project (UP): Krauss‐sama was actually surprisingly kind.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Krauss-sama was actually surprisingly kind.
PC Japanese (JP): 旦那様は、案外やさしい人だった。
Russian (RU): Господин Краусс на самом деле был на удивление добрым.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O patrão era, na verdade, surpreendentemente gentil.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 主人意外地是個好心腸的人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 主人意外地是个好心肠的人。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Krauss-sama era in realtà incredibilmente gentile.

Steam (ST): He must've gotten the impression that the Master bullied me a lot.
Umineko Project (UP): He must have gotten the impression that the Master bullied me a lot.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He must have gotten the impression that the Master bullied me a lot.
PC Japanese (JP): 僕が普段、よっぽどお館様にいじめられてると思い込んでいたんだろう。
Russian (RU): Стало быть, у него сложилось впечатление, что Господин слишком сильно меня запугал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele deve ter ficado com a impressão de que o Mestre me maltratava muito.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他似乎一直堅定不移地認為，我平時總是被老爺欺負呢。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他似乎一直坚定不移地认为，我平时总是被老爷欺负呢。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Deve aver avuto l'impressione che il Padrone mi maltrattasse molto.

Steam (ST): Whenever I was the only one around, he would talk to me in a very familiar way, almost as though he was a classmate of mine.
Umineko Project (UP): Whenever I was the only one around, he would talk to me in a very familiar way, almost as if he was a classmate of mine.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Whenever I was the only one around, he would talk to me in a very familiar way, almost as if he was a classmate of mine.
PC Japanese (JP): 僕しか姿がない時には、まるでクラスメートに話し掛けるように、親しげに話しかけてくれたっけ。
Russian (RU): Наедине он разговаривал со мной так обыденно, будто был моим одноклассником.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sempre que não havia mais ninguém por perto, ele conversava comigo de maneira bem familiar, quase como se fosse um colega de classe.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只有我在跟前的時候，他就像跟同學講話似的，非常親切地跟我說話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只有我在跟前的时候，他就像跟同学讲话似的，非常亲切地跟我说话。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando ero l'unico in giro, mi parlava in un modo molto confidenziale, come se fossi un suo compagno di classe.

Steam (ST): ...I sort of regret that I held back and never did anything but nod in return...
Umineko Project (UP): ......I sort of regret that I held back and never did anything but nod in return...

Umineko Project (UP): Madam was a really strict person...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Madam was a really strict person...

Steam (ST): ...Ever since some rumor went around saying that she was strict on female servants but soft towards male servants, I get the feeling she viewed me as an enemy.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Ever since a rumor spread about her being strict on female servants but soft towards male servants, I get the feeling she viewed me as an enemy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Ever since some rumor went around saying that she was strict on female servants but soft towards male servants, I get the feeling she viewed me as an enemy.
PC Japanese (JP): ……女の使用人には特に厳しかったけど、男の使用人には甘いとの陰口を聞いてしまってからは、僕を目の敵にしていた気がする。
Russian (RU): ......У меня возникло такое чувство, будто она рассматривает меня как врага, ещё с тех пор как пошли слухи, что она строга со служанками, но мягка со слугами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Sempre que se espalhava um rumor sobre como ela era rígida com as serviçais, mas dócil com os serviçais, eu tinha o sentimento de que ela se opunha à mim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……自從知道我們私下議論說太太對女傭人格外嚴厲，但是對男傭人就比較寬鬆之後，似乎就把我當成了眼中釘。

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Sin da quando circolarono delle voci che dicevano che lei fosse severa con le domestiche femmine ma dolce con quelli maschi, ebbi la sensazione che mi vedesse come un nemico.

Umineko Project (UP): However, she was also a woman to be pitied.

Steam (ST): Battler disappeared from that closed room. The chain lock is set.
Umineko Project (UP): Battler disappeared from that locked room.{n}The chain lock is set.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Battler disappeared from that closed room. The chain lock is set.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): あの密室から戦人が消えた。{n}チェーンロックは掛かってる。
Russian (RU): Баттлер исчез из закрытой комнаты.{n}Цепочка висит.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Battler desapareceu daquele quarto fechado.{n}A corrente de porta estava colocada.

Steam (ST): Did he disappear by magic? Of course not! There has to be a trick!
Umineko Project (UP): Did he disappear by magic? Of course not! There has to be a trick!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Did he disappear by magic? Of course not! There has to be a trick!

Chinese Simplified (CN): 用魔法消失了？荒谬！其中绝对有诡计！

Umineko Project (UP): He just came, took Battler's place, and set the chain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He just came, took Battler's place, and set the chain.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Everyone knows that much!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Everyone knows that much!

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Todos sabem disso!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……到這裡為止誰都想得通！
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……到这里为止谁都想得通！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Questo lo sanno tutti!

Steam (ST): The problem is the next step. No, it's actually the step before that one.
Umineko Project (UP): The problem is what comes next. No, it's actually what comes before.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The problem is the next step. No, it's actually the step before that one.

Steam (ST): Kanon was in the cousin room in the guesthouse.
Umineko Project (UP): Kanon was in the cousins' room in the guesthouse.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kanon was in the cousins' room in the guesthouse.
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音は、ゲストハウスのいとこ部屋にいた。
Russian (RU): Канон был в комнате кузенов домика для гостей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kanon estava no quarto dos primos, na casa de hóspedes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 嘉音在賓館的堂兄妹房間裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 嘉音在宾馆的堂兄妹房间里。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Kanon era nella stanza dei cugini nella casa degli ospiti.

Steam (ST): That room was completely sealed with packing tape, and it's been proven that the seal was intact until the time of the logic error.
Umineko Project (UP): That room was completely sealed with duct tape, and it has been proven that the seal was in effect until the time of the logic error.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That room was completely sealed with duct tape, and it has been proven that the seal was effective until the time of the logic error.
PC Japanese (JP): いとこ部屋はガムテープでの完全封印が、ロジックエラー時まで有効だったことが証明されてる。
Russian (RU): Уже доказано, что до момента логической ошибки эта комната была запечатана клейкой лентой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquele quarto estava completamente selado com a minha fita, e foi provado que o selo era válido até a hora do erro de lógica.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 堂兄妹房間通過膠帶實現的完全封印，已經證明了一直到發生邏輯錯誤之時，都是有效的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 堂兄妹房间通过胶带实现的完全封印，已经证明了一直到发生逻辑错误之时，都是有效的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quella stanza era completamente sigillata dal nastro adesivo ed è stato provato che il sigillo era efficace fino al momento del logic error.

Steam (ST): In other words, Kanon escaped from a closed room that was absolute, with no chance for excuses or twisted logic.
Umineko Project (UP): In other words, Kanon escaped from a locked room that was absolute, with no excuses or twisted logic possible.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, Kanon escaped from a closed room that was absolute, with no possible excuses or twisted logic.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、言い訳不能、屁理屈無用の、絶対密室から、嘉音は脱出しているのだ。
Russian (RU): В общем, Канон выбрался из абсолютной закрытой комнаты, без всяких возможных оправданий и каламбура.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O que significa que o Kanon escapou de um quarto que era absoluto, sem possíveis desculpas ou lógicas distorcidas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，無從辯駁，難以狡辯的絕對密室，嘉音從中逃脫了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，无从辩驳，难以狡辩的绝对密室，嘉音从中逃脱了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In altre parole, Kanon è scappato da una stanza chiusa che era assoluta, senza nessuna possibile scusa o logica contorta.

Steam (ST): <Good>! This is why she called it a simple yet ultimate closed room.
Umineko Project (UP): <Good>! This is why she called it a simple yet ultimate locked room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): <Good>! This is why she called it a simple yet ultimate closed room.
PC Japanese (JP): グッド！　これがあいつの言ってた、シンプルにして最高最悪の密室ってわけですね。
Russian (RU): <Good>! Вот почему она назвала её простой, но всё же конечной закрытой комнатой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {i:Good}! É por isso que ela o chamou de simples, porém supremo quarto fechado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): GOOD！這就是那傢伙說的，簡單明了，最厲害也是最惡劣的密室呢。
Chinese Simplified (CN): GOOD！这就是那家伙说的，简单明了，最厉害也是最恶劣的密室呢。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): {p:0:＜}Good{p:0:＞}! È per questo che l'ha chiamata una semplice ma definitiva stanza chiusa.

Steam (ST): ...How did he escape from the perfect closed room known as the cousin room?
Umineko Project (UP): .........How did he escape from the perfect locked room known as the cousins' room?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......How did he escape from the perfect closed room known as the cousins' room?
PC Japanese (JP): ………完全密室のいとこ部屋から、如何にして脱出するか。
Russian (RU): ......Как он выбрался из совершенной закрытой комнаты, известной как комната кузенов?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Como ele escapou do quarto fechado perfeito intitulado quarto dos primos?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………從堂兄妹房間這一完全密室之中，要如何逃脫？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………从堂兄妹房间这一完全密室之中，要如何逃脱？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Come è scappato dalla perfetta stanza chiusa conosciuta come stanza dei cugini?

Steam (ST): Heheh. If I got stuck thinking only about that question, I'd be no better than your average kid detective.
Umineko Project (UP): Heheh. If I fixated on that question, I'd be no better than your average kid detective.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Heheh. If I got stuck thinking only about that question, I'd be no better than your average kid detective.
PC Japanese (JP): ふふん。ここに固執する程度では、小林少年止まりですね。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ふふん。ここに固執する程度では、少年探偵止まりですね。
Russian (RU): Хе‐хех. Застряв на этом вопросе, я буду ничем не лучше псевдодетектива.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Heheh. Se eu ficar presa só nessa questão, eu não serei melhor do que aquele tal de Kobayashi Shounen.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 哼哼。要是拘泥於這個問題，那就也只有少年偵探的程度而已。

Steam (ST): ...That room is a perfect closed room, so "there is no way to escape".
Umineko Project (UP): ......That room is a perfect locked room, so {i:there is no way to escape}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......That room is a perfect closed room, so 'there is no way to escape'.
PC Japanese (JP): ……いとこ部屋は完全密室なんだから、“脱出の方法はない”。
Russian (RU): ......Эта комната — идеально закрытая, поэтому {i:способа выбраться нет}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Aquele cômodo é um quarto fechado perfeito, logo {i:não tem como escapar}.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……堂兄妹房间是完全的密室，所以“没有从中逃脱的办法”。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Quella stanza è una perfetta stanza chiusa, quindi ‘non c'è modo di scappare’.

Steam (ST): In other words, trying to think of ways to escape from there is a waste of time!
Umineko Project (UP): In other words, trying to think of ways that Kanon could have escaped from the cousins' room is simply a waste of time!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, trying to think of ways to escape from there is a waste of time!
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、いとこ部屋からどう脱出したかを考えるのはただの時間の無駄です！
Russian (RU): В общем, придумывать, как сбежать оттуда, пустая трата времени!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ou seja, tentar pensar em meios que o Kanon possa ter usado para escapar do quarto dos primos é uma total perda de tempo!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，思考怎麼從堂兄妹房間中逃出來不過是浪費時間！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，思考怎么从堂兄妹房间中逃出来不过是浪费时间！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In altre parole, provare a pensare a dei modi per scappare da lì è una perdita di tempo!

Steam (ST): The real question... is how Kanon was somewhere outside the cousin room when it was sealed.
Umineko Project (UP): The real question......is how Kanon...could have been somewhere other than the cousins' room at the time it was sealed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The real question...... is why Kanon wasn't in the cousins' room when it was sealed.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A verdadeira questão......é como o Kanon...poderia estar em outro lugar além do quartos dos primos no momento em que ele foi selado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不如說問題是，……嘉音是如何，在進行封印的時候不在堂兄妹房間裡的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不如说问题是，……嘉音是如何，在进行封印的时候不在堂兄妹房间里的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La vera domanda... è perché Kanon non era nella stanza dei cugini quando è stata sigillata.

Steam (ST): The cousin room is a completely sealed can. If he was in there when it was sealed, then it's already game over.
Umineko Project (UP): The cousins' room is a completely sealed can.{n}If he was in there when it was sealed, then it's already game over.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The cousins' room is a completely sealed can. If he was in there when it was sealed, then it's already game over.
PC Japanese (JP): いとこ部屋は完全な缶詰。封印時に中にいたら、もうゲームオーバー。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): いとこ部屋は完全な缶詰。{n}封印時に中にいたら、もうゲームオーバー。
Russian (RU): Комната кузенов — законсервированная банка.{n}Если он был там, когда её запечатали, игра уже окончена.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O quarto dos primos é uma lata completamente fechada.{n}Se ele estava lá quando foi selada, então não tem nem o que discutir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 堂兄妹房間是完全密封的。{n}如果封印的時候在裡面，那就玩完了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 堂兄妹房间是完全密封的。{n}如果封印的时候在里面，那就玩完了。

Steam (ST): In other words, ...at the time the cousin room was sealed, he wasn't inside it anymore!
Umineko Project (UP): That means, ......he was already outside it at the time it was sealed!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, ......at the time the cousins' room was sealed, he wasn't inside it anymore!
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、……いとこ部屋封印時には、もう中にいなかったわけです！
Russian (RU): Иными словами...... когда комната кузенов была запечатана, его там уже не было!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso significa ......que ele já estava fora no momento em que foi selada!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，……在封印堂兄妹房間的時候，他就已經不在裡面了！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，……在封印堂兄妹房间的时候，他就已经不在里面了！
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In altre parole... al momento in cui la stanza dei cugini è stata sigillata, lui non era più lì dentro!

Steam (ST): Let's look at the time I checked everyone's locations and sealed the rooms. That's the most suspicious part.
Umineko Project (UP): I checked everyone's location at the time of sealing the rooms.{n}That check I performed must be suspect.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, let's look at the time I checked everyone's locations and sealed the rooms. That's the most suspicious part.
PC Japanese (JP): となると、私が封印時にした所在確認。これが怪しいってことになります。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): となると、私が封印時にした所在確認。{n}これが怪しいってことになります。
Russian (RU): Давайте вспомним то время, когда я проверила, где все находятся, и запечатала комнаты.{n}Это самая подозрительная часть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu confirmei a localização de todos na hora em que selei os quartos.{n}Devo suspeitar da verificação que performei?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這樣一來，我在封印的時候確認各人的所在位置。{n}這個檢查就會變得很奇怪了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这样一来，我在封印的时候确认各人的所在位置。{n}这个检查就会变得很奇怪了。

Steam (ST): At that time, we have the five people in the next room over, whom I confirmed with my own eyes.
Umineko Project (UP): At that time, I had just been inside the next room over...and confirmed the presence of five people there with my own eyes.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At that time, we have the five people in the next room over, whom I confirmed with my own eyes.
PC Japanese (JP): 当時、私は、自分の所在した隣部屋について、実際に目視で存在を確認した５人。

Steam (ST): "{p:1:The cousin room is guaranteed to be a perfect closed room until the end.} {p:2:So, if Kanon really was in this room, it would be impossible for him to escape! In other words, it's possible for him to be in the next room over, not the cousin room!!}"

Russian (RU): "{p:1:Комната кузенов до самого конца была гарантированно совершенной закрытой комнатой.} {p:2:И будь Канон там, он бы не смог выбраться! Иначе говоря, когда комната была запечатана, Канона там не было! Его имя — псевдоним. Настоящее всё ещё неизвестно! Если его зовут так же, как кого‐либо в соседней комнате, это не противоречит проверке того, кто там был. Иными словами, он мог быть в соседней комнате, а не в комнате кузенов}!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "{p:1:Foi garantido que o quarto dos primos é um quarto perfeito até o final}. {p:2:Logo, se Kanon realmente estivesse naquele quarto, seria impossível que ele escapasse! Ou seja, Kanon não estava no quarto dos primos no momento em que o mesmo foi selado!! O nome de Kanon é um pseudônimo. Seu verdadeiro nome ainda é desconhecido! Se o nome dele for o mesmo que qualquer um no quarto ao lado, isso não iria contradizer a verificação que ocorreu naquele quarto. Em outras palavras, é possível que ele estivesse no quarto ao lado, e não no quarto dos primos}!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「{p:1:堂兄妹房間是完全的密室，這一點直到最後都是受到保證的。}{p:2:因此，嘉音如果真的在這間房裡，就是不可能逃出來的！也就是說，嘉音在封印的時候根本就不在堂兄妹房間裡！！嘉音是個假名字。本名目前不明！假如他的本名跟鄰房裡的某人是一樣的話，就不會與鄰房裡的所在位置確認相矛盾。也就是說，他可以不進入堂兄妹房間，而在鄰房之內！！}」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「{p:1:堂兄妹房间是完全的密室，这一点直到最后都是受到保证的。}{p:2:因此，嘉音如果真的在这间房里，就是不可能逃出来的！也就是说，嘉音在封印的时候根本就不在堂兄妹房间里！！嘉音是个假名字。本名目前不明！假如他的本名跟邻房里的某人是一样的话，就不会与邻房里的所在位置确认相矛盾。也就是说，他可以不进入堂兄妹房间，而在邻房之内！！}」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "{p:1:È garantito che la stanza dei cugini è una perfetta stanza chiusa fino alla fine. {p:2:} {p:2:Quindi, se Kanon era davvero in quella stanza, sarebbe stato impossibile per lui scappare!} {p:2:In altre parole, Kanon non era in quella stanza nel momento in cui è stata sigillata!!} {p:2:Il nome di Kanon è un alias.} {p:2:Il suo vero nome è ancora sconosciuto!} {p:2:Se per caso il suo nome è lo stesso di qualcuno nella stanza accanto, non contraddirebbe il controllo di chi ci fosse in quella stanza.} {p:2:In altre parole, è possibile per lui essere nella stanza accanto, non nella stanza dei cugini!!}"

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "{p:1:At the time the next room over was sealed, Hideyoshi, George, Kumasawa, Shannon, and Nanjo were in it. And, the number of people in the next room over was five. No one existed there except for those to whom those five names refer! All people can only go by their own names!!}"

Russian (RU): "{p:1:Когда соседняя комната была запечатана, там были Хидэёши, Джордж, Кумасава, Шаннон и Нанджо. Число людей в соседней комнате — пять. Нет никого, за исключением тех, к кому относятся эти пять упомянутых имён! Все люди могут использовать только свои имена}!"

Não existia ninguém exceto aqueles os quais os cinco nomes se referem! Cada nome pertence a uma única pessoa e ninguém pode contar com um nome que não lhe pertence}!!"

Steam (ST): Also, it was now clear that only people holding those five names existed within the room. Erika couldn't even make a new theory by suggesting that one person held two names, so that the five names referred to only four people, which would let an unnamed Kanon sneak in.
Umineko Project (UP): Since only those to whom those five names referred existed within the room, Erika couldn't even make a new theory by suggesting that one person held two names, so that the five names referred to only four people, and allowing for Kanon to sneak in even though his name wasn't on the list.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Since only those to whom those five names referred existed within the room, Erika couldn't even make a new theory by suggesting that one person held two names, so that the five names referred to only four people, and allowing for Kanon to sneak in even though his name wasn't on the list.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、５つの名に該当しない者は存在しないと言い切られたため、１人の人物が２つの名前を持つことで、５つの名前を４人で満たし、名前を持たぬ嘉音を１人紛れ込ますという、新しい推理までも否定されてしまった。
Russian (RU): Раз в комнате были только люди с пятью упомянутыми именами, Эрика даже не могла создать новую теорию, предположив, что у одного человека два имени, поэтому пять имён относятся только к четырём людям, и что так Канон проник туда даже если его имени не было в списке.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como apenas aqueles os quais os cinco nomes se referem existem dentro do quarto, Erika sequer poderia fazer uma nova teoria, sugerindo que uma pessoa tivesse dois nomes, para que os cinco nomes se referisse a apenas quatro pessoas, permitindo que Kanon se infiltrasse, mesmo que seu nome não estivesse na lista.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且，因為對方明言了除了這 5 個名字所指稱的人以外不存在其他人，1 個人有兩個名字，5 個名字對應 4 個人，嘉音沒有名字所以能夠混進去，諸如此類的新的推理都被否定了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且，因为对方明言了除了这 5 个名字所指称的人以外不存在其他人，1 个人有两个名字，5 个名字对应 4 个人，嘉音没有名字所以能够混进去，诸如此类的新的推理都被否定了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dato che all'interno della stanza esistevano solo coloro a cui si riferivano quei cinque nomi, Erika non poteva nemmeno formulare una nuova teoria che suggeriva che una persona tesse due nomi, così che i cinque nomi si riferissero soltanto a quattro persone, permettendo a Kanon di intrufolarsi nonostante il suo nome non fosse sulla lista.

Steam (ST): Furthermore, the part about how people could only use their own names was a fatal blow that cut down countless theories...!

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ademais, a parte sobre "cada nome pertence a uma única pessoa, e ninguém pode contar com um nome que não lhe pertence" foi um golpe fatal que eliminou incontáveis teorias...!

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "...O-Of course!! You've already used the red truth to guarantee that Kanon saved Battler! It's only natural that I be given this privilege...!"

PC Japanese (JP): 「と、……当然です！！　あんたは、嘉音が戦人を助けたことを赤き真実で保証してるんですから！　そんなのもらえて当然です…！」

PC Japanese (JP): {p:2:以上の理由により、この間、内側からしか施錠できないチェーンロックを施錠状態にして脱出するには、私と戦人以外で唯一の入室者である、嘉音にしか出来ない！

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {p:2:Pelos motivos supracitados, o único que poderia ter colocado a corrente de porta, a qual só pode ser posta por dentro, e permitir que Battler escapasse...é Kanon, a única pessoa que entrou no quarto além de mim e do Battler!}

Chinese Simplified (CN): {p:2:根据以上理由，在这段时间内，让只能从内侧锁上的链条锁保持锁上的状态，在此情况下逃脱，只有除了我和战人之外剩下的唯一一个进入房间的人，也就是嘉音才做得到！}

Russian (RU): "......{p:2:‘Трюк с исчезновением Баттлера из гостевой комнаты’ заключается в следующем. ......Пока я обыскивала комнату, Баттлер прятался в шкафу. Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......{p:2:‘O truque de desaparecimento do quarto de hóspedes do Battler se deu da seguinte forma: ......Enquanto eu procurava pelo quarto, Battler estava escondido no closet. Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「呵，……咯咯咯咯咯咯咯咯咯咯…。接下來才是重頭戲。……這是，知曉了同時存在的兩個真實之後，人類給出的答案。…………而且不管怎麼說，幻想故事裡，儀式到第二晚就結束了呢。……那麼就讓我實現剩下的幾晚，……打開通往黃金鄉的大門吧。………你落敗消失的時候。在黃金玫瑰的包圍之中是合適不過的了…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「呵，……咯咯咯咯咯咯咯咯咯咯…。接下来才是重头戏。……这是，知晓了同时存在的两个真实之后，人类给出的答案。…………而且不管怎么说，幻想故事里，仪式到第二晚就结束了呢。……那么就让我实现剩下的几晚，……打开通往黄金乡的大门吧。………你落败消失的时候。在黄金玫瑰的包围之中是合适不过的了…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Pft... *cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*... la prossima è quella vera. {n}Questa è la risposta da parte di un umano capace di capire molteplici verità. ... Sembra che il racconto dell'illusione finirà al secondo crepuscolo. ... Perciò, perché non compiere i restanti crepuscoli... e aprire la porta della Terra Dorata. ... Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "This is detective Furudo Erika's final parting line... and self-introduction!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "This is the final parting line from the detective, Furudo Erika, and my self‐introduction!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "This is the final parting line from the detective, Furudo Erika, and my self-introduction!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「これがッ、探偵、古戸ヱリカの最後の捨て台詞ッ、そして自己紹介です！！」
Russian (RU): "Вот заключительная прощальная фраза детектива, Фурудо Эрики, а также моё введение!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Esta é a fala de despedida da detetive, Furudo Erika, e também a minha apresentação!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這就是，偵探，古戶繪梨花最後拋出的台詞，也是自我介紹！！」

Steam (ST): Erika spun in a magnificent and graceful rondo, scattering blood and golden flower petals around her as she raised her gun.
Umineko Project (UP): Erika spun around in a magnificent and graceful rondo, scattering blood and golden petals around her as she raised her gun.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Erika spun around in a rondo, and with a magnificent and graceful motion, scattering blood and golden flower petals around her, she raised her gun.
PC Japanese (JP): ヱリカはくるりとロンドを踊りながら、華麗に優美に、……血と黄金の花びらを散らしながら舞って、銃を構える。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Erika rodopiou em um magnífico e gracioso rondó, espalhando sangue e pétalas douradas em seu entorno enquanto erguia sua arma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪梨花轉了個圈，像是在跳輪舞一般，華麗而優美地，……飛散著鮮血和黃金花瓣地起舞，然後舉起槍。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘梨花转了个圈，像是在跳轮舞一般，华丽而优美地，……飞散着鲜血和黄金花瓣地起舞，然后举起枪。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Erika girò attorno in un rondò, e con un magnifico e grazioso movimento, disperdendo sangue e petali dorati attorno a lei, sollevò la sua pistola.

Steam (ST): "{p:1:Hi, pleased to meet you! I'm Furudo Erika, the detective!! I may be an uninvited guest, but please, welcome me!!}"
